 0005: 
 0006: """
 0007: Interpolation between lines with array-based border values.
 0008: 
 0009: This module allows blending interpolation results with an existing image/array
 0010: at the borders, rather than using a constant value. Useful for compositing
 0011: operations where out-of-bounds regions should show through to a background.
 0012: """
 0013:

+0115:     for h in prange(H, nogil=True, schedule='static', num_threads=num_threads):
  {
      __Pyx_UnknownThreadState _save;
      _save = __Pyx_SaveUnknownThread();
      __Pyx_FastGIL_Remember();
      /*try:*/ {
        __pyx_t_1 = __pyx_v_H;
        {
            #if ((defined(__APPLE__) || defined(__OSX__)) && (defined(__GNUC__) && (__GNUC__ > 2 || (__GNUC__ == 2 && (__GNUC_MINOR__ > 95)))))
                #undef likely
                #undef unlikely
                #define likely(x)   (x)
                #define unlikely(x) (x)
            #endif
            __pyx_t_3 = (__pyx_t_1 - 0 + 1 - 1/abs(1)) / 1;
            if (__pyx_t_3 > 0)
            {
                #ifdef _OPENMP
                #pragma omp parallel
                #endif /* _OPENMP */

+0542:                     border_val = border_array_mv[n, ch]

+0543:                     out_mv[n, ch] = edge_val + border_res.blend_factor * (border_val - edge_val)

                                  __pyx_t_13 = __pyx_v_ch;

 0544:                 else:
+0545:                     out_mv[n, ch] = edge_val
                                /*else*/ {

static PyObject *__pyx_pf_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_lerp_between_lines_1ch_array_border(CYTHON_UNUSED PyObject *__pyx_self, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_line0, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_line1, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_coords, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_border_array, int __pyx_v_border_mode, __pyx_t_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_f64 __pyx_v_border_feathering, int __pyx_v_distance_mode, int __pyx_v_num_threads) {

  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_l0 = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_l1 = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_c = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };

  PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_out = 0;
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_out_mv = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };

 0562:     Single-channel interpolation with per-pixel border values from an array.

+0777: def lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_array_border(
/* Python wrapper */

#else

#endif
); /*proto*/
PyDoc_STRVAR(__pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_6lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_array_border, "\n    Flat multi-channel interpolation with per-point border values.\n    \n    Args:\n        line0: First line, shape (L, C)\n        line1: Second line, shape (L, C)\n        coords: Flat coordinates, shape (N, 2)\n        border_array: Background values, shape (N, C)\n        border_modes: Border mode for each channel, shape (C,)\n        border_feathering: Feathering width\n        distance_mode: Distance metric - int for all channels, or array shape (C,)  # NEW\n        num_threads: Number of threads (-1 = auto)\n    \n    Returns:\n        Interpolated values blended with border_array, shape (N, C)\n    ");
static PyMethodDef __pyx_mdef_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_7lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_array_border = {"lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_array_border", (PyCFunction)(void(*)(void))(__Pyx_PyCFunction_FastCallWithKeywords)__pyx_pw_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_7lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_array_border, __Pyx_METH_FASTCALL|METH_KEYWORDS, __pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_6lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_array_border};

+0958: def lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_per_ch_coords_array_border(
/* Python wrapper */

static PyObject *__pyx_pf_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_12lerp_between_lines_x_discrete_multichannel_array_border(CYTHON_UNUSED PyObject *__pyx_self, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_line0, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_line1, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_coords, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_border_array, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_border_modes, __pyx_t_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_f64 __pyx_v_border_feathering, PyObject *__pyx_v_distance_mode, int __pyx_v_num_threads) {
  Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_L;
  Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_C;
  Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_H;
  Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_W;
  PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_dm_arr = 0;
  int __pyx_v_n_threads;
  PyObject *__pyx_v_os = NULL;
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_l0 = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_l1 = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_c = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_ba = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_bm = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_dm = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_out = 0;
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_out_mv = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_border_array;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_border_array;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_border_modes;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_border_modes;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_coords;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_coords;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_dm_arr;

 1242: ):
 1243:     """
 1244:     Single-channel discrete x-sampling with per-pixel border values from array.
 1245:     
 1246:     Snaps u_x to nearest line index (no interpolation along x),
 1247:     interpolates continuously along y.
 1248:     
 1249:     Args:
 1250:         line0: First line, shape (L,)
 1251:         line1: Second line, shape (L,)
 1252:         coords: Coordinate grid, shape (H, W, 2)
 1253:         border_array: Background/border values, shape (H, W)
 1254:         border_mode: Border handling mode
 1255:         border_feathering: Feathering width for smooth blending (0.0 = hard edge)
 1256:         distance_mode: Distance metric for 2D border computation

 1258:     
 1259:     Returns:
 1260:         Interpolated values blended with border_array, shape (H, W)

 1374: # Public API - Discrete X-Sampling Flat Multi-Channel with Array Border

+1376: def lerp_between_lines_x_discrete_flat_multichannel_array_border(
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_21lerp_between_lines_x_discrete_flat_multichannel_array_border(PyObject *__pyx_self, 
#if CYTHON_METH_FASTCALL

  goto __pyx_L0;

 1552: 
 1553: # =============================================================================
 1554: # Smart Dispatcher
 1555: # =============================================================================
 1556: DEF MIN_PARALLEL_SIZE = 10000
 1557: 
+1558: def lerp_between_lines_onto_array(
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_25lerp_between_lines_onto_array(PyObject *__pyx_self, 
#if CYTHON_METH_FASTCALL
PyObject *const *__pyx_args, Py_ssize_t __pyx_nargs, PyObject *__pyx_kwds
#else
PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds
#endif
); /*proto*/
PyDoc_STRVAR(__pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_24lerp_between_lines_onto_array, "\n    Smart dispatcher for interpolation that composites onto a background array.\n    \n    Automatically selects the appropriate kernel based on input shapes.\n    The interpolation result is blended with border_array at out-of-bounds regions.\n    \n    Args:\n        line0: First line, shape (L,) or (L, C)\n        line1: Second line, shape (L,) or (L, C)\n        coords: Coordinate array, shape:\n            - (H, W, 2) for grid\n            - (N, 2) for flat\n            - (C, H, W, 2) for per-channel grid\n            - (C, N, 2) for per-channel flat\n        border_array: Background to composite onto, shape:\n            - (H, W) or (N,) for single channel\n            - (H, W, C) or (N, C) for multi-channel\n        border_mode: Border mode(s):\n            - int: Same for all channels (default: BORDER_CONSTANT)\n            - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)\n        border_feathering: Feathering width for smooth blending (0.0 = hard edge)\n        distance_mode: Distance metric for 2D border computation:  # NEW\n            - None: Use ALPHA_MAX (default)\n            - int: Same for all channels\n            - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)\n        num_threads: Number of threads (-1=auto, 0=serial, >0=specific)\n        x_discrete: If True, use discrete x-sampling (nearest neighbor in x)\n    \n    Returns:\n        Interpolated values composited onto border_array\n    \n    Example:\n        # Composite interpolation onto existing image\n        background = np.random.rand(100, 100, 3)\n        result = lerp_between_lines_onto_array(\n            line0, line1, coords, background,\n            border_feathering=0.1  # Smooth 10% feathering at edges\n        )\n    ");
static PyMethodDef __pyx_mdef_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_25lerp_between_lines_onto_array = {"lerp_between_lines_onto_array", (PyCFunction)(void(*)(void))(__Pyx_PyCFunction_FastCallWithKeywords)__pyx_pw_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_25lerp_between_lines_onto_array, __Pyx_METH_FASTCALL|METH_KEYWORDS, __pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_24lerp_between_lines_onto_array};

  __Pyx_GOTREF(__pyx_t_5);

 1568: ):
 1569:     """
 1570:     Smart dispatcher for interpolation that composites onto a background array.
 1571:     
 1572:     Automatically selects the appropriate kernel based on input shapes.
 1573:     The interpolation result is blended with border_array at out-of-bounds regions.
 1574:     
 1575:     Args:
 1576:         line0: First line, shape (L,) or (L, C)
 1577:         line1: Second line, shape (L,) or (L, C)
 1578:         coords: Coordinate array, shape:
 1579:             - (H, W, 2) for grid
 1580:             - (N, 2) for flat
 1581:             - (C, H, W, 2) for per-channel grid
 1582:             - (C, N, 2) for per-channel flat
 1583:         border_array: Background to composite onto, shape:
 1584:             - (H, W) or (N,) for single channel
 1585:             - (H, W, C) or (N, C) for multi-channel
 1586:         border_mode: Border mode(s):
 1587:             - int: Same for all channels (default: BORDER_CONSTANT)
 1588:             - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)
 1589:         border_feathering: Feathering width for smooth blending (0.0 = hard edge)
 1590:         distance_mode: Distance metric for 2D border computation:  # NEW
 1591:             - None: Use ALPHA_MAX (default)
 1592:             - int: Same for all channels
 1593:             - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)
 1594:         num_threads: Number of threads (-1=auto, 0=serial, >0=specific)
 1595:         x_discrete: If True, use discrete x-sampling (nearest neighbor in x)
 1596:     
 1597:     Returns:
 1598:         Interpolated values composited onto border_array
 1599:     
 1600:     Example:
 1601:         # Composite interpolation onto existing image
 1602:         background = np.random.rand(100, 100, 3)
 1603:         result = lerp_between_lines_onto_array(
 1604:             line0, line1, coords, background,
 1605:             border_feathering=0.1  # Smooth 10% feathering at edges
 1606:         )
 1607:     """
 1608:     cdef Py_ssize_t total_size
+1609:     cdef int use_threads = num_threads
  __pyx_v_use_threads = __pyx_v_num_threads;

 1610:     cdef Py_ssize_t C
 1611:     cdef np.ndarray[i32, ndim=1] bm_arr
 1612:     cdef np.ndarray[i32, ndim=1] dm_arr
 1613:     cdef int bm_scalar
 1614:     cdef int dm_scalar
+1615:     cdef int coords_ndim = coords.ndim
  __pyx_v_coords_ndim = __pyx_f_5numpy_7ndarray_4ndim_ndim(__pyx_v_coords);

 1760: # =============================================================================
 1761: # In-place Kernels (write directly to border_array)
 1762: # =============================================================================
+1763: cdef inline void _lerp_multichannel_inplace_kernel(
static CYTHON_INLINE void __pyx_f_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border__lerp_multichannel_inplace_kernel(__Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_l0, __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_l1, __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_c, __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_inout_mv, __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_border_modes_mv, __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_distance_modes_mv, __pyx_t_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_f64 __pyx_v_border_feathering, Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_H, Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_W, Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_L, Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_C, CYTHON_UNUSED int __pyx_v_num_threads) {
  Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_h;
  Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_w;
  Py_ssize_t __pyx_v_ch;

PyDoc_STRVAR(__pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_28lerp_between_lines_multichannel_inplace, "\n    Multi-channel in-place interpolation onto target array.\n    \n    Modifies target_array directly - in-bounds regions are overwritten,\n    out-of-bounds regions are left unchanged (or blended with feathering).\n    \n    Args:\n        line0: First line, shape (L, C)\n        line1: Second line, shape (L, C)\n        coords: Coordinate grid, shape (H, W, 2)\n        target_array: Array to modify in-place, shape (H, W, C)\n        border_modes: Border mode for each channel, shape (C,)\n        border_feathering: Feathering width\n        distance_mode: Distance metric - int for all channels, or array shape (C,)  # NEW\n        num_threads: Number of threads (-1 = auto)\n    ");

 2130: ):
 2131:     """
 2132:     Multi-channel in-place interpolation onto target array.
 2133:     
 2134:     Modifies target_array directly - in-bounds regions are overwritten,
 2135:     out-of-bounds regions are left unchanged (or blended with feathering).
 2136:     
 2137:     Args:
 2138:         line0: First line, shape (L, C)
 2139:         line1: Second line, shape (L, C)
 2140:         coords: Coordinate grid, shape (H, W, 2)

static PyObject *__pyx_pf_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_32lerp_between_lines_flat_multichannel_inplace(CYTHON_UNUSED PyObject *__pyx_self, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_line0, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_line1, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_coords, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_target_array, PyArrayObject *__pyx_v_border_modes, __pyx_t_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_f64 __pyx_v_border_feathering, PyObject *__pyx_v_distance_mode, int __pyx_v_num_threads) {

  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_l1 = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_c = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };

  __Pyx_memviewslice __pyx_v_dm = { 0, 0, { 0 }, { 0 }, { 0 } };
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_border_modes;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_border_modes;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_coords;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_coords;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_dm_arr;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_dm_arr;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_line0;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_line0;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_line1;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_line1;
  __Pyx_LocalBuf_ND __pyx_pybuffernd_target_array;
  __Pyx_Buffer __pyx_pybuffer_target_array;
  PyObject *__pyx_r = NULL;
  __Pyx_INCREF((PyObject *)__pyx_v_line0);

  __pyx_pybuffer_dm_arr.refcount = 0;
  __pyx_pybuffernd_dm_arr.data = NULL;
  __pyx_pybuffernd_dm_arr.rcbuffer = &__pyx_pybuffer_dm_arr;

#if CYTHON_METH_FASTCALL
PyObject *const *__pyx_args, Py_ssize_t __pyx_nargs, PyObject *__pyx_kwds
#else

#endif

PyDoc_STRVAR(__pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_38lerp_between_lines_x_discrete_multichannel_inplace, "\n    Multi-channel discrete x-sampling in-place interpolation.\n    \n    Modifies target_array directly - in-bounds regions are overwritten,\n    out-of-bounds regions are left unchanged (or blended with feathering).\n    \n    Args:\n        line0: First line, shape (L, C)\n        line1: Second line, shape (L, C)\n        coords: Coordinate grid, shape (H, W, 2)\n        target_array: Array to modify in-place, shape (H, W, C)\n        border_modes: Border mode for each channel, shape (C,)\n        border_feathering: Feathering width\n        distance_mode: Distance metric - int for all channels, or array shape (C,)\n        num_threads: Number of threads (-1 = auto)\n    ");

  for (Py_ssize_t __pyx_temp=0; __pyx_temp < (Py_ssize_t)(sizeof(values)/sizeof(values[0])); ++__pyx_temp) {

  goto __pyx_L7_cleaned_up;
  __pyx_L0:;

  return __pyx_r;

 2476: ):
 2477:     """
 2478:     Multi-channel discrete x-sampling in-place interpolation.
 2479:     
 2480:     Modifies target_array directly - in-bounds regions are overwritten,
 2481:     out-of-bounds regions are left unchanged (or blended with feathering).
 2482:     
 2483:     Args:
 2484:         line0: First line, shape (L, C)
 2485:         line1: Second line, shape (L, C)
 2486:         coords: Coordinate grid, shape (H, W, 2)
 2487:         target_array: Array to modify in-place, shape (H, W, C)
 2488:         border_modes: Border mode for each channel, shape (C,)
 2489:         border_feathering: Feathering width
 2490:         distance_mode: Distance metric - int for all channels, or array shape (C,)
 2491:         num_threads: Number of threads (-1 = auto)
 2492:     """
+2493:     cdef Py_ssize_t L = line0.shape[0]

 2629: # =============================================================================
 2630: # Smart In-place Dispatcher
 2631: # =============================================================================
+2632: def lerp_between_lines_inplace(
/* Python wrapper */
static PyObject *__pyx_pw_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_43lerp_between_lines_inplace(PyObject *__pyx_self, 
#if CYTHON_METH_FASTCALL
PyObject *const *__pyx_args, Py_ssize_t __pyx_nargs, PyObject *__pyx_kwds
#else
PyObject *__pyx_args, PyObject *__pyx_kwds
#endif
); /*proto*/
PyDoc_STRVAR(__pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_42lerp_between_lines_inplace, "\n    Smart dispatcher for in-place interpolation onto a target array.\n    \n    Modifies target_array directly - writes interpolated values where\n    coordinates are in-bounds, leaves out-of-bounds regions unchanged\n    (or blends them with feathering).\n    \n    This is more efficient than lerp_between_lines_onto_array when you\n    want to modify an existing array without creating a copy.\n    \n    Args:\n        line0: First line, shape (L,) or (L, C)\n        line1: Second line, shape (L,) or (L, C)\n        coords: Coordinate array, shape (H, W, 2) or (N, 2)\n        target_array: Array to modify in-place (must be C-contiguous)\n        border_mode: Border mode(s):\n            - int: Same for all channels (default: BORDER_CONSTANT)\n            - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)\n        border_feathering: Feathering width for smooth blending\n        distance_mode: Distance metric for 2D border computation:  # NEW\n            - None: Use ALPHA_MAX (default)\n            - int: Same for all channels\n            - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)\n        num_threads: Number of threads (-1=auto, 0=serial, >0=specific)\n        x_discrete: If True, use discrete x-sampling (nearest neighbor in x)  # NEW\n    \n    Example:\n        # Modify image in-place with discrete x-sampling\n        image = np.random.rand(100, 100, 3)\n        lerp_between_lines_inplace(\n            line0, line1, coords, image,\n            border_feathering=0.1,\n            x_discrete=True\n        )\n        # image is now modified\n    ");
static PyMethodDef __pyx_mdef_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_43lerp_between_lines_inplace = {"lerp_between_lines_inplace", (PyCFunction)(void(*)(void))(__Pyx_PyCFunction_FastCallWithKeywords)__pyx_pw_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_43lerp_between_lines_inplace, __Pyx_METH_FASTCALL|METH_KEYWORDS, __pyx_doc_10chromatica_6v2core_9interp_2d_22interp_2d_array_border_42lerp_between_lines_inplace};

  goto __pyx_L7_cleaned_up;
  __pyx_L0:;
  for (Py_ssize_t __pyx_temp=0; __pyx_temp < (Py_ssize_t)(sizeof(values)/sizeof(values[0])); ++__pyx_temp) {
    Py_XDECREF(values[__pyx_temp]);
  }
  __pyx_L7_cleaned_up:;
  __Pyx_RefNannyFinishContext();
  return __pyx_r;
}

  __pyx_t_5 = __Pyx_PyBool_FromLong(((int)0)); if (unlikely(!__pyx_t_5)) __PYX_ERR(0, 2641, __pyx_L1_error)
  __Pyx_GOTREF(__pyx_t_5);

 2642: ):
 2643:     """
 2644:     Smart dispatcher for in-place interpolation onto a target array.
 2645:     
 2646:     Modifies target_array directly - writes interpolated values where
 2647:     coordinates are in-bounds, leaves out-of-bounds regions unchanged
 2648:     (or blends them with feathering).
 2649:     
 2650:     This is more efficient than lerp_between_lines_onto_array when you
 2651:     want to modify an existing array without creating a copy.
 2652:     
 2653:     Args:
 2654:         line0: First line, shape (L,) or (L, C)
 2655:         line1: Second line, shape (L,) or (L, C)
 2656:         coords: Coordinate array, shape (H, W, 2) or (N, 2)
 2657:         target_array: Array to modify in-place (must be C-contiguous)
 2658:         border_mode: Border mode(s):
 2659:             - int: Same for all channels (default: BORDER_CONSTANT)
 2660:             - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)
 2661:         border_feathering: Feathering width for smooth blending
 2662:         distance_mode: Distance metric for 2D border computation:  # NEW
 2663:             - None: Use ALPHA_MAX (default)
 2664:             - int: Same for all channels
 2665:             - list/array: Per-channel modes, shape (C,)
 2666:         num_threads: Number of threads (-1=auto, 0=serial, >0=specific)
 2667:         x_discrete: If True, use discrete x-sampling (nearest neighbor in x)  # NEW
 2668:     
 2669:     Example:
 2670:         # Modify image in-place with discrete x-sampling
 2671:         image = np.random.rand(100, 100, 3)
 2672:         lerp_between_lines_inplace(
 2673:             line0, line1, coords, image,
 2674:             border_feathering=0.1,
 2675:             x_discrete=True
 2676:         )
 2677:         # image is now modified
 2678:     """
 2679:     cdef Py_ssize_t total_size
+2680:     cdef int use_threads = num_threads
  __pyx_v_use_threads = __pyx_v_num_threads;

 2681:     cdef Py_ssize_t C
 2682:     cdef np.ndarray[i32, ndim=1] bm_arr
 2683:     cdef np.ndarray[i32, ndim=1] dm_arr
 2684:     cdef int bm_scalar
 2685:     cdef int dm_scalar
+2686:     cdef int coords_ndim = coords.ndim
